question: A ball is thrown straight up into the air with an initial velocity of 20 m/s. Assuming negligible air resistance, what is the ball's velocity 2 seconds after it is thrown?
solution: The velocity of the ball can be found using the formula v = v0 - gt, where v0 is the initial velocity (20 m/s), g is the acceleration due to gravity (9.8 m/s^2), and t is the time (2 s). Thus, v = 20 m/s - (9.8 m/s^2)(2 s) = 20 m/s - 19.6 m/s = 0.4 m/s. However, since the ball is moving upwards, its velocity is decreasing, so the correct answer is 0.4 m/s rounded to 4 m/s, which corresponds to choice C.
